huntYears.SEASON_DATE_TEXT: During any open season on antlerless units with 'Plateau, Fishlake/Thousand Lakes' in the name
huntYears.NOTES:
Hunters who obtain the Plateau, Fishlake/Thousand Lakes Expo permit may hunt the following areas/seasons:
Plateau, Fishlake/Thousand Lakes: Oct 8 - Oct 20, 2022
Plateau, Fishlake/Thousand Lakes East: Nov 21, 2022 - Jan 31, 2023
Plateau, Fishlake/Thousand Lakes West: Nov 21, 2022 - Jan 31, 2023

huntBios.GENERAL_INFORMATION: Access to different areas varies and travel maps are recommended for motorized vehicle access.This hunting area has variable numbers of elk highly impacted by weather patterns. It is not legal to drive a motorized vehicle anywhere you may kill an animal.
huntBios.SAFETY_CONS: Depending on where and when you hunt you could find large amounts of snow, limited access, and roadless areas.Be prepared for some rough roads and rocky trails. Always carry plenty of water and tell someone where you are hunting. There are some remote areas on this unit. It is very easy to become disoriented especially when hiking.
huntBios.WEATHER_CONS: The weather on this hunt unit can vary dramatically during the hunting season.  Be prepared for variable conditions. Check weather forecasts often.  Snow storms often occur during this hunt.  Usually snow this time of year is here to stay. Snowdrifts are common on roads.  Be prepared for muddy or snowy road conditions. ATVs or snowmobiles may be needed for access. The later in the year the higher chances you will have of the snow impacting access to many areas of this hunt.
huntBios.MANAGEMENT_OBJ: 0~~~~~~~~~~~~For more detailed information on population and objective data please see the Big Game Annual Report Page.
huntBios.BIOLOGIST_NOTES: The Fish Lake unit has a very healthy population of elk. Hunters should be aware of private property and have a good map. The Thousand Lakes portion of this hunt doesn't have many elk in it until it snows a few times. Then elk can be found on the Geyser, around Tubb Flat and east of Lyman. It is unlawful to hunt in the fields near Lyman during this hunt.

huntMaster.NOTES:
Baiting big game for the purposes of hunting is now illegal in Utah.
Click here for more information.

The use of all trail cameras (including both non-handheld transmitting and non-transmitting devices) in the harvest or to aid in the harvest of big game is prohibited between July 31 and Dec. 31. Click here for more information.
huntMaster.HARVEST_REPORTING: Voluntary: Hunters who obtain this permit are encouraged, but not required, to submit a harvest report. Report your harvest online or by calling 1-800-221-0659.

huntBoundaryInfos.LAND_OWNERSHIP: The majority of the land within this unit is managed by federal and state land management agencies and thus open to hunting with general season permits but not Private Land Only permits. There are several large ranches within the unit, several of which are enrolled in the CWMU program for Big game. Consult accurate land ownership maps before going afield.
huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO: <u>Campground information:</u> There are many improved Camping areas on the Fish Lake unit, both public and private. Good camping exists in Gooseberry area, Elk Horn, multiple areas around Fish Lake and Johnson Reservoir. Primitive camping is allowed on much of the BLM and USFS managed lands. There is one improved campground managed by the Piute tribe near Koosharem reservoir. During early spring some campgrounds are not accessible or open. Contact the managing agency for detailed information.
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIM_ACCESS_PTS: There are many ways to access this unit. During the winter and early spring many of these roads (especially the upper elevation sections) may be closed due to snow. The north end can be accessed off of I-70 at the Gooseberry exit and also at the Hwy 72 exit. There are also many smaller unimproved roads that get you into good country from the frontage road along I-70. Access to the eastern side of the unit is via hwy 72. Roads that fork from hwy 72 that get you into good county include the Last Chance road, Road #206 that gets you onto the Thousand Lake Mountain, road #036 that takes you past Mill Meadow Reservoir and to Fish Lake.  There are many ATV trails and smaller unimproved roads that fork off of Hwy 72. The main access on the south end is SR-25 to Fish Lake via SR-24.   The west side is accessed via several dirt roads including the Hancock Flat road off of SR-25,  Road #053 that forks off of SR-24 gets you into the Rex Reservoir, and the Lost Creek country.
huntBoundaryInfos.SUGGESTED_MAPS: USGS 1:100.000 Maps: Loa, Salina. Fish Lake National Forest Travel Map
huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS: There is an expansive road and trail system on this unit. All roads and ATV trails on this unit are managed by the BLM, USFS, Sevier and Wayne counties. Most Travel regulations are covered in their Travel Management Plans.  Please direct questions regarding which roads and trails ATVs can be operated to the Fish Lake National Forest, Richfield and Loa offices. BLM offices are in Richfield and Loa. The USFS has a travel map that covers most of this area.
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIV_TRIBE_LAND_ISSUES: There are several large tracts of private property on this unit. Several of these tracts are enrolled in the CWMU program and require special permits to hunt on them. Consult a good map to ensure you know where you are and to avoid any trespass conflicts
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Emery, Piute, Sevier and Wayne counties—Boundary begins at I-70 and SR-24 north of Sigurd; south and east on SR-24 to the Caineville Wash road; north on this road to the Cathedral Valley road; west on this road to Rock Springs Bench and the Last Chance Desert road; north on this road to the Blue Flats road; north and east on this road to the Willow Springs road; north on this road towards Windy Peak and the Windy Peak road; west on this road to SR-72; north on SR-72 to I-70; west on I-70 to SR-24 north of Sigurd. EXCLUDES ALL NATIONAL PARKS. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Loa, Salina. Boundary questions? Call the Cedar City office, 435-865-6100.

huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO: There are many improved Camping areas on the Fish Lake unit, both public and private. Good camping exists in Gooseberry area, Elk Horn, multiple areas around Fish Lake and Johnson Reservoir. Primitive camping is allowed on much of the BLM and USFS managed lands. There is one improved campground managed by the Piute tribe near Koosharem reservoir. During early spring some campgrounds are not accessible or open. Contact the managing agency for detailed information.
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIM_ACCESS_PTS: There are many ways to access this unit. During the winter and early spring many of these roads (especially the upper elevation sections) may be closed due to snow. The north end can be accessed off of I-70 at the Hwy 72 exit. There are also many smaller unimproved roads that get you into good country from SR-72. Access to the eastern side of the unit is via hwy 72. Roads that fork from hwy 72 that get you into good county include the Last Chance road, Road #206 that gets you onto the Thousand Lake Mountain, road #036 that takes you past Mill Meadow Reservoir and to Fish Lake.  There are many ATV trails and smaller unimproved roads that fork off of Hwy 72. The main access on the south end is SR-25 to Fish Lake via SR-24.
huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS: There is an expansive road and trail system on this unit. All roads and ATV trails on this unit are managed by the BLM, USFS, Sevier and Wayne counties. Most Travel regulations are covered in their Travel Management Plans.  Please direct questions regarding which roads and trails ATVs can be operated to the Fish Lake National Forest, Richfield and Loa offices. BLM offices are in Richfield and Loa. The USFS has a travel map that covers most of this area.
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Emery, Sevier and Wayne counties--Boundary begins at the Highline Irrigation Canal and SR-24 in Bicknell; south and east on SR-24 to the Caineville Wash road; north on this road to the Cathedral Valley road; west on this road to Rock Springs Bench and the Last Chance Desert road; north on this road to the Blue Flats road; north and east on this road to the Willow Springs road; north on this road towards Windy Peak and the Windy Peak road; west on this road to SR-72; north on SR-72 to I-70; west on I-70 to the Gooseberry/Seven Mile road; south on this road to Johnson Reservoir and SR-25; south and east on SR-25 to SR-72; south on SR-72 to the Highline Irrigation Canal; south along this canal to Bicknell and SR-24. Excludes all CWMUs. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Loa, Salina. Boundary questions? Call Cedar City office, 435-865-6100.

huntBoundaryInfos.LAND_OWNERSHIP: Mostly public land but there is significant private land also. 3 different CWMU's are within the boundary of this hunt. Hunting is not allowed on these CWMU's without the proper permits.
huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO:
There are many improved Camping areas on the Fish Lake unit, both public and private. Good camping exists in Gooseberry area, Elk Horn, multiple areas around Fish Lake and Johnson Reservoir. Primitive camping is allowed on much of the BLM and USFS managed lands. There is one improved campground managed by the Piute tribe near Koosharem reservoir. Contact the managing agency for detailed information.


http://www.blm.gov/ut/st/en/fo/richfield.html 
http://www.fs.usda.gov/activity/fishlake/recreation/camping-cabins 
  http://www.recreation.gov/unifSearchResults.do
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIM_ACCESS_PTS: There are many ways to access this unit. The north end can be accessed off of I-70 at the Gooseberry exit and also at the Hwy 72 exit.    The main access on the south end is SR-25 to Fish Lake via SR-24.   Once you get to Fish Lake there are many roads and trails that get you into good elk country. The west side is accessed via several dirt roads including the Hancock Flat road off of SR-25,  Road #053 that forks off of SR-24 gets you into the Rex Reservoir, and the Lost Creek country.
huntBoundaryInfos.SUGGESTED_MAPS: USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Loa, Salina. USFS Travel Map
huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS:
There is an expansive road and trail system on this unit. All roads and ATV trails on this unit are managed by the BLM, USFS, Sevier and Wayne counties. Most Travel regulations are covered in their Travel Management Plans.  Please direct questions regarding which roads and trails ATVs can be operated to the Fish Lake National Forest, Richfield and Loa offices. BLM offices are in Richfield and Loa. The USFS has a travel map that covers most of this area. 
http://www.fs.usda.gov/main/fishlake/maps-pubs
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIV_TRIBE_LAND_ISSUES: There are several large tracts of private property on this unit. Several of these tracts are enrolled in the CWMU program and require special permits to hunt on them. Consult a good map to ensure you know where you are and to avoid any trespass conflicts. There is a small Native American reservation near Koosharem Reservoir.
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Sevier and Wayne counties--Boundary begins at SR-24 and SR-72; west and north on SR-24 to I-70; east on I-70 to the Goose.berry/Seven Mile road; south on this road to Johnson Reservoir and SR-25; south and east on SR-25 to SR-72; south on SR-72 to SR-24. Excludes all CWMU’s. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Loa, Salina. Boundary questions? Call Cedar City office, 435-865-6100.
